posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I don't think the WM critical hit enhancements are worth all the trouble you go through to get them. A Bard 26 Fighter 4 RDD 10 would probably be much stronger, and with WS and EWS, would probably do more damage a round than that one. I generally avoid the Scythe / Devcrit combo, moreso on a WM build. You'll already crit SOOOOOOOO hard that DC is almost a wasted feat. If you do, say 200 damage on a critical, you can kill things pretty fast. If you change the weapon for a scimitar, you'll crit more often, but your AC will be much higher thanks to the shield. If you're going for this class combo, then IMO pick a Scimitar or Rapier as your weapon, or dual-wield Kukris to make the best use of the Devcrit feat.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
The reason you don't see Bard/RDD/WM builds with Dev Crit is that in such a feat-starved build, you wind up taking several pre-epic feats on epic levels, wasting opportunities to take epic feats. You wind up with no Great Strength, no Armor Skin and no Epic Prowess. Generally, if you want Dev Crit, it is better to take either RDD or WM, but not both.

Here are two builds that replace RDD or WM with Fighter for more feats and for EWS, but they keep Bard and use scimitars to get more criticals and allow you to use a shield. After that are two builds that do the same but replace Bard with Monk to dual-wield kamas to have more attacks and therefore more chances at crits.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
I believe my colleagues have found most of the key weaknesses of this combo... agree completely. Kudos to Empyre for scrounging up some links to viable alternatives.

In my own experience, in order to optimize any DevCrit build, one should concentrate on maximizing APR and crit range, pretty lame with a scythe compared to DW and/or weapon switch (I prefer DW kukris myself with a shield switch back-up, but requires DEX 15). Elevated STR will take care of the the third requisite (DC) so that should be a manageable issue. In a low- to mid-magic environment where it may be difficult to reach ability and AB caps, Empower Spell may help boost that DC significantly to consider selecting it (sorta like having an extra 2 Grt STRs in place temporarily, over standard Bull's). But when feat-starved, well... you have placed yourself between a rock and hard place as far as feat flexibility goes.

posts.author: TyrTemplar
posts.content:
When it comes to dev.crit, you need three things: 1) not only a high AB to land the crit in the first place, but a 2) DC so as to make the whole thing worthwhile and 3) a good Fort save so as to avoid being dev.critted into oblivion yourself!

If it's STR/DC you want, nothing beats the RDD (and this gives you DC). Sure, the dragon STR can be seen perhaps as freeing up some feats so as to squeeze WM in there so far as from RDD you get STR, but no such thing as to much STR in a dev.crit build (or any melee build for that matter; not only does STR = damage, but also AB to land not only that damage but the potential to crit in the first place, with STR also speaking to DC so as to make going after dev.crit worthwhile as said. The WM's crit threshold is nice of course, but it winds up costing too much if you go the RDD route, thus only winding up detracting from the "strength" (aka focus, and pun fully intended) as compared to combining your RDD with i.e. FTR, Barbarian or Paladin instead.

See, for e.g.,
Wing Commander (Red Squadron) 26 Paladin/10 RDD/4 Bard (OR, to avoid an alignment change: 29 Paladin/10 RDD/1 Sorcerer), http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 77359.html . (DEV CRIT DC: 44, +1 curse: 45 / 48 self-buff (no equipment) / DC 52 STR-capped). AB 48+1song: 49 (naked) / 70 self-buffed (no equipment), 536HPs, 182 skillpoints, and HIGH FORT save (37 self-buffed, no items or equipment); with reasonable items, can basically dev.crit with impunity (remember, in PvP especially where dev.crit's allowed, you'll hardly be the only one with that ability and what among other things paladin brings to the mix).

For the crit.threshold, though, if you're OK not playing a dragon, then by all means go WM and lots of it! See, Blade, (FTR (11)/Bard(1)/WM (28) http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 46241.html (Naked AB 52+1 Song ; Dev.Crit (DC) 42 (48 Str.Cap), Naked Fort 26, 536 HP, 217 skillpoints). Give him a scimitar focus, bring all that WM goodness to bear (now you be forcing the crits!). Just keep in mind that this is a PG-Build (playability dumped for lvl 40 power, as per the discussion therein as to options re: playability in different worlds (PvP, PvM, and the setting: i.e., the lower the magic, can drop a level of FTR to take another bard instead (give up 4 damage to gain early access UMD/boosts/buffs and versatility as per the discussion).

Then, if you like forcing the crits, STR-based, dual-wielding monk/rangers do just that. See, Green Beret, CoT 14, Ranger 10, Monk 16 , http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 72542.html Devastating Crit (DC): 42 (str. cap: 48); like the pal/RDD, nice saves (Fort: 36 Naked), 448 HPs, and a nice AC (only 187 skillpoints), and whilst the crit. threshold on a kama isn't the best, dual-wielding with monk speed and a Naked AB 45 you'll force tons of them so no worries!

In NWN2, we liked Bard/WM/RDDs, but then, it was a different game (no dev.crit, but had 4 classes to play with i.e. Bard/WM/RDD/Fighter, and KD, disarm hence STR (AB etc.) and of course the "ordinary" critting/farming instead.

Hope this helps, and CRIT ON!

Tyr
